Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.

ALLEGATION: The resident coughed up blood and lost consciousness.
INVESTIGATION:
State Worker 1 interviewed Youth A on 01/10/20. State Worker 1 and I interviewed
Youth A on 01/13/2020. Youth A described being upset about getting a smaller amount
of ice cream for dessert, which led to her harming herself, becoming more agitated, and
then having difficulty breathing, coughing up blood, and going in and out of
consciousness. Youth A stated she was taken to the hospital where she was treated
and released to go back to the facility.
2

Supervisor 1 was interviewed at the facility on 01/13/20. Supervisor 1 also stated Youth
A was taken to the hospital for medical treatment. Supervisor 1 also provided
documentation of the medical treatment that was provided. Youth A was diagnosed
with Acute Bronchitis and Asthma Exacerbation. Youth A was given a chest X-Ray and
respiratory treatments.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
(1) An institution shall establish and follow written health
service policies and procedures addressing all of the
following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and
behavioral health care.
ANALYSIS: The findings of this investigation substantiated the fact that
Youth A was provided appropriate medical treatment at the time
of this incident under investigation. Documentation of the
medical treatment was received and everyone interviewed
reported the medical care was provided timely.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION: This resident has been antagonized and verbally mistreated by staff.
INVESTIGATION:
State Worker 1 interviewed Youth A on 01/10/20. State Worker 1 and I interviewed
Youth A on 01/13/2020. Youth A reported she was downstairs in the kitchen area when
Staff 1 started following Youth A. Youth A stated she told Staff 1 to “back off” but Staff 1
told Youth A she was “on watch” and Staff 1 had to keep an eye on Youth A. Youth A
reported she kept trying to get away from Staff 1, but Staff 1 kept following Youth A,
even though Youth A was in full view of multiple staff members at the time. Youth A
stated she got tired of Staff 1 being in her space and felt like Staff 1 “was antagonizing
me”, so Youth A pushed Staff 1. Youth A stated Staff 1 then tried to restrain Youth A
and when Youth A pulled away Youth A got a small scratch on her wrist. Youth A
stated Staff 2 stepped between Youth A and Staff 1 and stopped the altercation. Youth
A stated she tried to prevent the incident from becoming physical by trying to walk away
from Staff 1, but the more Staff 1 followed Youth A the more Youth A felt threatened.
A video of the incident was available and was reviewed on 01/13/20 with State Worker
1. The video was consistent with the description reported by Youth A.
3

Youth B (DOB: 06/10/03) was interviewed at the facility on 01/13/20 with State Worker
1. Youth B described Youth A as aggressive with both peers and staff. Youth B stated
he would have anxiety/panic attacks due to Youth A’s aggressive behaviors. Youth B
stated he was not present at the time of the incident viewed on the video.
Staff 1 was interviewed by State Worker 1 on 01/16/20. Staff 1 stated Youth A had
kicked at another resident and Staff 1 thought Youth A was beginning to escalate her
behaviors. Staff 1 stated she feared for the safety of the other residents, so she began
to follow Youth A. Staff 1 reported that Youth A was “on watch” so Youth A had to be
within eyesight of staff at all times. Staff 1 described Youth A as walking around and
Staff 1 followed Youth A. Staff 1 stated Youth A told Staff 1 to stop following her and
Staff 1 told Youth A she was following her due to safety concerns. Staff 1 stated Youth
A began to swing at Staff 1 and Staff 1 grabbed Youth A’s arm to try to restrain Youth A.
Staff 1 stated she asked Staff 2 to assist in a restraint when Youth A yanked her arm
away from Staff 1. Staff 1 stated Youth A eventually calmed down and apologized for
hitting Staff 1. Staff 1 confirmed she was not specifically assigned to watch Youth A
and any staff member could have watched Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility by State Worker 1 on 01/10/20. Staff 2 described
the incident similar to the descriptions reported by Youth A and Staff 1. Staff 2 stated
she told Staff 1 to “back off” as Staff 2 was also within eyesight of Youth A and Staff 1
following Youth A was making Youth A more antagonized. Staff 2 stated that when
Youth A pushed Staff 1 Staff 2 stepped between Staff 1 and Youth A and told Staff 1
she was not going to restrain Youth A. Staff 2 stated she did not think Youth A needed
to be restrained.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4157 Behavior management.
(1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies
and procedures that describe the institution’s behavior
management system. The policies and procedures shall be
reviewed annually and updated as needed. These shall be
available to all residents, their families, and referring
agencies.
4

ANALYSIS: The findings of this investigation support the determination that
Staff 1 violated the behavior management policy of this facility
by escalating the situation with Youth A. The focus of the policy
and training of the facility is to deescalate a situation with a
youth as much as possible. The description of the incident
provided by Youth A, Staff 1, and Staff 2 all indicated an
awareness that Youth A was threatened/antagonized by Staff 1
following Youth A even though Youth A continued to be in
eyesight of other staff members. It was also evident in the video
that other staff members were present, and Youth A was
agitated by Staff 1 continuing to follow Youth A.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend with the submission and acceptance of an approved corrective action
plan the current license status of this child caring institution-private be maintained.
